schema.description:
Returns the current semester (default) or the semester that was/will be current at the given _date_.

"current" is defined according to one of the following rules:
* _calendar_ (default): the calendar period of the semester (1st of October till 31st of March for WS)
* _lecture_: any date after the end of the lecture period is assigned to the next semester
* _exam_: as defined in APSO any date until the end of the first week of lecture period is assigned to the previous semester.

value.maintext:
Garching, %DATUM_HEUTE%

Betreff: Ihr Studienfortschritt im {{ program.degree_program_name }}

 

%SEHRGEEHRT% %VORNAME% %NAMENSZUSATZ%%FAMILIENNAME%,

die vielfltigen Anforderungen eines Studiums zu erfllen, fllt nicht immer leicht. Die TUM mchte Sie daher hiermit frhzeitig auf offensichtliche Schwierigkeiten in Ihrem Studium aufmerksam machen. Wir empfehlen Ihnen dringend, ber die Ursachen Ihres nicht im Plan liegenden Studienfortschritts nachzudenken und die Studienfachberatung oder andere Anlaufstellen aufzusuchen.

Wir mchten Sie bei der Umsetzung Ihrer eigenen Ziele bestmglich untersttzen. Dazu bentigen wir Ihre Mitwirkung, Ihr Interesse am Studienfach und auch Ihren Willen, die erforderliche Zeit und das unverzichtbare Engagement fr Ihr Studium aufzubringen.

Damit Sie unsere Erwartung an Ihre Mitwirkung einordnen knnen, mchten wir Sie darauf hinweisen, dass wir in der Auslegung unserer Module im Mittel von 30 Stunden Arbeit je Credit ausgehen, was bei 30 Credits pro Semester einer Belastung von 1800 Stunden im Jahr entspricht. Werden Prfungen verzgert, der Studienablauf signifikant verndert oder wird die Arbeit vor allem in die Prfungsvorbereitung geschoben, so steigt der erforderliche Aufwand fr Sie noch einmal zustzlich an. Um das Studium sptestens zum achten Fachsemester - also erfolgreich innerhalb der Studienfortschrittskontrolle - abzuschlieen, mssen im Mittel mindestens 20 Credits pro Semester erworben werden.

In Ihrem Fall haben wir festgestellt, dass Sie sich aktuell im {{ fachsemester }}. Fachsemester befinden{% if frv %}, wobei eine gewhrte Fristverlngerung von {% if frv==1 %}einem Semester{% else %}{{ frv|format_number }} Semestern{% endif %} bercksichtigt wird,{% endif %} aber bisher lediglich {{ credits }} CP erworben haben.{% if credits and special_warning_credits %} Darunter nur {{ special_warning_credits }} Credits in fr die Grundlagenprfung relevanten Fchern.{% endif %}

Was bedeutet das fr die kommenden Semester?

Durch noch nicht bestandene oder aufgeschobene Prfungen kann fr Sie in den nchsten Semestern eine sehr hohe Prfungsbelastung entstehen. Konkret ist fr Ihren Studienerfolg erforderlich: {% for semester in program.progresschecks %}{% if semester.fachsemester>=fachsemester_effective %}nach dem {{ semester.fachsemester + (frv or 0) }}. Fachsemester mindestens {% if semester.credits %}{{ semester.credits }} Credits{% endif %}{% if semester.special_check %}{% if semester.credits %}, davon{% endif %} {{ semester.special_check }}{% endif %}{% if not loop.last %}, {% endif %}{% endif %}{% endfor %}. Wenn diese Grenzen nicht erreicht werden, greift die Studienfortschrittskontrolle mit einem Ausschluss aus dem Studium.

Nehmen Sie daher, soweit noch nicht geschehen, bitte kurzfristig Kontakt mit einer Vertrauensperson Ihrer Wahl oder mit einem der folgenden Ansprechpartner auf:

- Dr. Philipp Hffer v. Loewenfeld (Sprechstunde Montag nachmittag und, wenn die Brotr offen steht) oder das Team der Studienberatung in Physik (https://academics.nat.tum.de/beratung#c4487)

- Dr. Katja Block (Sprechstunde Montag 9:30-11:30 und Mittowch 13:30-15:30) als Ansprechpartnerin fr das Studium in besonderen Lebenslagen

- Allgemeine Studienberatung; Untersttzung bei Neuorientierung oder alternativen Studienmglichkeiten sowie Lern- und Prfungscoaching (https://www.tum.de/studium/hilfe-und-beratung)

- Studierendenwerk (https://www.studierendenwerk-muenchen-oberbayern.de/beratungsnetzwerk/): Anlaufstelle fr soziale und wirtschaftliche Fragen wie z.B. Studienfinanzierung, psychologische Beratung etc.

Kommen Sie auf uns zu wir sind fr Sie da.

Ich wnsche Ihnen viel Erfolg in den kommenden Semestern.

value.maintext:
Garching, %DATUM_HEUTE%

Subject: Your academic progress in the {{ program.degree_program_name }}

 

Dear %VORNAME% %NAMENSZUSATZ%%FAMILIENNAME%,

keeping apace with the demands of full-time study is not always easy. When difficulties do arise, however, it is best to address them as quickly as possible. We are writing today in an effort to call your attention early to your apparent difficulties in meeting your academic progress targets. We strongly recommend that you consider the factors leading to these difficulties and seek out academic counseling.

Our goal is to support you as good as possible in meeting your own goals. In order to do so, we require your participation, your interest in your field of study and your willingness to devote the necessary time and level of commitment to your degree program.

To help you better understand our expectations, we would like to explain that the design of our degree program modules is based on an average of 30 hours of work per credit, which, at 30 credits per semester, corresponds to a workload of 1800 hours per academic year. If examinations are postponed, if the progression of studies significantly shifts from the planned curriculum, or if the completion of course requirements is pushed into periods of time intended for exam preparation, the effort necessary for you to master the workload increases exponentially. In order to complete the study program within six semesters - and hence within the targets specified by the academic progress check - a student needs to earn on average 20 credits per semester.

In your case, we have found that you have earned only {{ credits }} CP{% if credits and special_warning_credits is not none %} including {{ special_warning_credits }} CP in Physics special courses{% endif %} by your {{ fachsemester }}. semester{% if frv %}, where an extension of {% if frv==1 %}one semester{% else %}{{ frv|format_number("cardinal", "en") }} semesters{% endif %} is accounted for{% endif %}.

So what does this mean for the coming semesters?

Examinations that have not yet been passed or have been postponed can place a very high examination load on you in the coming semesters. In concrete terms, to successfully complete your studies, you need to have earned {% for semester in program.progresschecks %}{% if semester.fachsemester>=fachsemester_effective %}after {{ semester.fachsemester + (frv or 0) }}. semester at least{% if semester.credits %} {{ semester.credits }} CP{% endif %}{% if semester.special_check_en %}{% if semester.credits %} and therein{% endif %} {{ semester.special_check_en }}{% endif %}{% if not loop.last %}, {% endif %}{% endif %}{% endfor %}. If these minimums are not achieved, the academic progress check takes effect to expel you from the program.

We, thus, again encourage you to contact the trusted person of your choice or someone at one of the following services as soon as possible:

- Dr. Martin Sa (consultation hour regularly Wednesday and Thursday morning) or the team of study organisation and counceling in Physics (https://academics.nat.tum.de/en/counseling#c4487)

- Dr. Katja Block (consultation hour Monday 9:30-11:30 and Wednesday 13:30-15:30) as contact person for studying with special needs

- Student Advising; support with new academic orientation or alternative options for study, as well as learning and examination coaching (https://www.tum.de/en/studies/support-and-advice)

- Student Union (https://www.studierendenwerk-muenchen-oberbayern.de/en/advisory-network): contact point for social and financial issues, such as paying for your studies, psychological counseling, etc.

Come and talk to us we are here to help.

Wishing you all the best in the coming semesters.

Martin Sa

1.summary: Student Ranking for the 1st semester in the B.Sc. Physics

value.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 1. Semester im B.Sc. Physik im WS 2022/3
value.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the 1st semester in the B.Sc. Physics in WS 2022/3
value.cohort: Die Studierenden mssen sich im ersten Studienjahr der Grundlagen- und Orientierungsprfung (GOP) unterziehen.
value.cohort_en: The students are subjected to the Fundamentals and Orientation Examinations (GOP) during the first year of studies.
value.ranking_base: Als Grundlage werden ausschlielich die Pflichtmodule aus dem ersten Teil der Grundlagen- und Orientierungsprfung herangezogen.
value.ranking_base_en: The ranking is based on modules from the first part of the Fundamentals and Orientation Examinations (GOP) only.

2.summary: Student Ranking for the 2nd semester in the B.Sc. Physics

value.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 2. Semester im B.Sc. Physik im SS 2023
value.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the 2nd semester in the B.Sc. Physics in SS 2023
value.cohort: Die Kohorte bestand zum Studienbeginn im Wintersemester 2022/3 aus 441 Studierenden, die sich im ersten Studienjahr der Grundlagen- und Orientierungsprfung (GOP) unterziehen.
value.cohort_en: In the starting semester in 2022/3, the cohort had 441 enrolled students. These were subjected to the Fundamentals and Orientation Examinations (GOP) during the first year of studies.
value.ranking_base: Als Grundlage werden ausschlielich die Pflichtmodule aus den Grundlagen- und Orientierungsprfung herangezogen.
value.ranking_base_en: The ranking is based on modules from the Fundamentals and Orientation Examinations (GOP) only.

3.summary: Student Ranking for the 3rd semester in the B.Sc. Physics

value.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 3. Semester im B.Sc. Physik im WS 2022/3
value.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the 3rd semester in the B.Sc. Physics in WS 2022/3
value.cohort: Die Kohorte bestand zum Studienbeginn im Wintersemester 2021/2 aus 486 Studierenden. Im ersten Studienjahr findet die Grundlagen- und Orientierungsprfung (GOP) statt. Studierende, die den ersten Teil der GOP im WS 2021/2 endgltig nicht bestanden haben, wurden daher bereits exmatrikuliert. Insbesondere beim Vergleich mit Rankings in Studiengngen ohne GOP fhrt dies zu einer erheblichen Verzerrung zum Nachteil der Studierenden, die die GOP bestanden haben, da Studierende mit schlechteren Leistungen aus der Grundgesamtheit ausgeschieden sind. Im WS 2021/2 waren alle prfungsrechtlichen Fristen aufgrund der Einschrnkungen durch die COVID-19-Pandemie ausgesetzt.
value.cohort_en: In the starting semester in 2021/2 the cohort had 486 enrolled students. These were subjected to the Fundamentals and Orientation Examinations (GOP) during the first year of studies. It therefore needs to be considered, that students who have irreversibly failed the first part of the GOP in WS 2021/2, have already been exmatriculated. Especially when comparing with rankings from programs without GOP, this leads to a significant bias to the disadvantage of students who passed the GOP, as students with a poorer performance were excluded from the student cohort. Due to the restrictions during the COVID-19 pandemic, all exam-related deadlines and requirements were postponed in WS 2021/2.
value.ranking_base: Als Grundlage werden ausschlielich Pflicht- und Wahlmodule, die in den Studiengang eingehen herangezogen.
value.ranking_base_en: The ranking is based on modules according to the exam regulations only.

Allerdings waren im WS 2021/2 alle prfungsrechtlichen Fristen auf Grund der Einschrnkungen durch die COVID-19-Pandemie ausgesetzt.

But due to the restrictions during the COVID-19 pandemic all exam-related deadlines and requirements were postponed in WS 2021/2.

5.summary: Student Ranking for the 5th semester in the B.Sc. Physics

value.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 5. Semester im B.Sc. Physik im WS 2023/4
value.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the 5th semester in the B.Sc. Physics in WS 2023/4
value.cohort: Die Kohorte bestand zum Studienbeginn im Wintersemester 2021/2 aus 486 Studierenden. Im ersten Studienjahr findet die Grundlagen- und Orientierungsprfung (GOP) statt. Es ist daher zu beachten, dass Studierende, die die GOP in den vergangenen Semestern endgltig nicht bestanden haben, bereits exmatrikuliert wurden. Insbesondere beim Vergleich mit Rankings in Studiengngen ohne GOP kann dies zu einer erheblichen Verzerrung zum Nachteil der Studierenden fhren, die die GOP bestanden haben, da Studierende mit schlechteren Leistungen aus der Grundgesamtheit ausgeschieden sind. Im WS 2021/2 waren alle prfungsrechtlichen Fristen aufgrund der Einschrnkungen durch die COVID-19-Pandemie ausgesetzt.
value.cohort_en: In the starting semester in 2021/2 the cohort had 486 enrolled students. These were subjected to the Fundamentals and Orientation Examinations (GOP) during the first year of studies. It therefore needs to be considered, that students who have irreversibly failed the GOP in the past semesters have already been exmatriculated. Especially when comparing with rankings from programs without GOP, this can lead to a significant bias to the disadvantage of students who passed the GOP, as students with a poorer performance were excluded from the student cohort. Due to the restrictions during the COVID-19 pandemic, all exam-related deadlines and requirements were postponed in WS 2021/2.
value.ranking_base: Als Grundlage werden ausschlielich Pflicht- und Wahlmodule, die in den Studiengang eingehen herangezogen.
value.ranking_base_en: The ranking is based on modules according to the exam regulations only.

value.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 6. Semester im B.Sc. Physik im SS 2023
value.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the 6th semester in the B.Sc. Physics in SS 2023
value.cohort: Die Kohorte bestand zum Studienbeginn im Wintersemester 2020/1 aus 512 Studierenden, die sich im ersten Studienjahr der Grundlagen- und Orientierungsprfung (GOP) unterziehen mussten. Allerdings waren von SS 2020 bis einschlielich WS 2021/2 alle prfungsrechtlichen Fristen auf Grund der Einschrnkungen durch die COVID-19-Pandemie ausgesetzt.
value.cohort_en: In the starting semester in 2020/1 the cohort had 512 enrolled students. These were subjected to the Fundamentals and Orientation Examinations (GOP) during the first year of studies. But due to the restrictions during the COVID-19 pandemic all exam-related deadlines and requirements were postponed in SS 2020 until including WS 2021/2.
value.ranking_base: Als Grundlage werden ausschlielich Pflicht- und Wahlmodule, die in den Studiengang eingehen herangezogen.
value.ranking_base_en: The ranking is based on modules according to the exam regulations only.

7.summary: Student Ranking for the First Year in the Physics Masters Programs

value.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 1. Studienjahr in den Physik-Masterstudiengngen im WS 2022/3
value.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the First Year in the Physics Masters Programs in WS 2022/3
value.cohort: Fr das Ranking werden die vier Masterstudiengnge Physik zusammengefasst, da sie durch die identische Studiengangsstruktur vergleichbar sind. Die Kohorte umfasst alle Studierenden im ersten Studienjahr, in dem die Vertiefungsphase des Masterstudiums stattfindet.
value.cohort_en: The ranking combines the four Masters programs in Physics. Due to the identical structure of these study programs, these are comparable. The cohort includes all students within their first year of studies during the Masters programs phase of advanced studies.
value.ranking_base: Als Grundlage werden ausschlielich Pflicht- und Wahlmodule der Vertiefungsphase, die in den Studiengang eingehen herangezogen.
value.ranking_base_en: The ranking is based on modules of the advanced studies of the program according to the exam regulations only.

8.summary: Student Ranking for the Second Year in the Physics Masters Programs

value.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 2. Studienjahr in den Physik-Masterstudiengngen im WS 2022/3
value.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the Second Year in the Physics Masters Programs in WS 2022/3
value.cohort: Fr das Ranking werden die vier Masterstudiengnge Physik zusammengefasst, da sie durch die identische Studiengangsstruktur vergleichbar sind. Die Kohorte umfasst alle Studierenden im zweiten Studienjahr, in dem die Forschungsphase des Masterstudiums stattfindet. Von WS 2020/1 bis WS 2021/2 waren alle prfungsrechtlichen Fristen aufgrund der Einschrnkungen durch die COVID-19-Pandemie ausgesetzt.
value.cohort_en: The ranking combines the four Masters programs in Physics. Due to the identical structure of these study programs, these are comparable. The cohort includes all students within their second year of studies during the Masters programs research phase. Due to the restrictions during the COVID-19 pandemic, all exam-related deadlines and requirements were postponed in the semesters from winter 2020/1 to winter 2021/2.
value.ranking_base: Als Grundlage werden ausschlielich Pflicht- und Wahlmodule, die in den Studiengang eingehen herangezogen.
value.ranking_base_en: The ranking is based on modules according to the exam regulations only.

get.description:
Get list of users eligible to vote in this Rundlauf.

Returns all committee members except supervisor, chairman and examiners.

Applies a time filter to only include Rundlufe from the last two months.
This ensures that the returned list contains recent or ongoing Rundlufe relevant to the user's potential voting responsibilities.
Retrieves a list of Rundlufe associated with the PhD candidate making the request, ensuring the user has the 'candidate' role within the 'phd' application context.

Get a list of Rundlauf's. 
Hereby please consider which filter options you will use:
        
-> complete = true: you will receive a list of Rundlauf which have a complete timestamp
        
-> started = true: you will receive a list of rundlauf which have a start_date
        
-> both are false: you will receive a list of rundlauf in which none have a start_date or a complete timestamp

id.title: A unique identifier of an event. Useful for getEventById.

groupId.title: Events that share a groupId will be dragged and resized together automatically.

allDay.title: Determines if the event is shown in the "all-day" section of relevant views. In addition, if true the time text is not displayed with the event.

start.title: Date object that obeys the current timeZone. When an event begins.

end.title: Date object that obeys the current timeZone. When an event ends. It could be null if no end was specified.

title.title: The text that will appear on an event.

url.title: A URL that will be visited when this event is clicked by the user. For more information on controlling this behavior, see the eventClick callback.

classNames.title: An array of strings like [ 'myclass1', myclass2' ]. Determines which HTML classNames will be attached to the rendered event.

display.title: The rendering type of this event. Can be 'auto', 'block', 'list-item', 'background', 'inverse-background', or 'none'. See eventDisplay.

overlap.title: The value overriding the eventOverlap setting for this specific event. If false, prevents this event from being dragged/resized over other events. Also prevents other events from being dragged/resized over this event. Does not accept a function.

extendedProps.title: A plain object holding miscellaneous other properties specified during parsing. Receives properties in the explicitly given extendedProps hash as well as other non-standard properties.

grade.title: Grade (numerical 1.0, 1.3 to 5.0), may be None only if grade_remark is set to "X".

body:
{{ gender.greeting }},
zur {{ ceremony.ceremony_title }} am {{ ceremony.ceremony_date|format_date('%d.%m.%Y um %H:%M') }} Uhr mchten wir Sie herzlich einladen. Das detaillierte Programm finden Sie anbei sowie unter {{ ceremony.url }}.
Falls noch nicht erfolgt, bitten wir Sie baldmglichst noch um Rckmeldung ber unser Online-Formular unter {{ dssnat_frontend_url }}feedback/feedback?token={{ invitation_id }}.
ber Ihre Teilnahme wrden wir uns sehr freuen!
Der Link zum Rckmeldeformular ist ber den QR-Code erreichbar:
Der QR-Code enthlt Ihre persnliche Einladungs-UUID {{ invitation_id }}.

Mit freundlichen Gren

i.A. Prof. Johannes Barth
Dekan der TUM School of Natural Sciences

example.ranking: Semester-Ranking fr das 2. Semester im B.Sc. Physik im SS 2022
example.ranking_en: Student Ranking for the 2nd semester in the B.Sc. Physics in SS 2022
example.text:
{{ fullname }} war im {{ ranking.semester.semester_tag }} im {{ program.degree_program_name }} im {{ fachsemester }}. Fachsemester immatrikuliert und erreichte am Ende dieses Semesters {{ credits }} Credits{% if grade_cut or (grade_node_cut and grade_node_cut<=4) %} und eine Durchschnittsnote von {{ (grade_cut or grade_node_cut)|string|replace(".",",") }}{% else %}, wobei eine Durchschnittsnote noch nicht ermittelbar war{% endif %}. Damit belegt {{ gender.sieer }} unter den {{ ranking.student_count }} Studierenden desselben Semesters{% if rankshared_count and rankshared_count>1 %} zusammen mit {{ rankshared_count }} anderen Studierenden{% elif rankshared_count %} zusammen mit einer/m anderen Studierenden{% endif %} den Rangplatz {{ rank }} und gehrt zu den besten {{ percentile }}%.{% if ranking.start_cohort_count %}
Zu Beginn des Studiums im ersten Fachsemester bestand die Kohorte aus {{ ranking.start_cohort_count }} Studierenden.{% endif %}
example.text_en:
{{ fullname }} was enrolled in the {{ program.degree_program_name_en }} in the {{ fachsemester }}. semester during {{ ranking.semester.semester_tag }}. At the end of the semester {{ gender.shehe }} achieved {{ credits }} credits{% if grade_cut or (grade_node_cut and grade_node_cut<=4) %} and an average grade of {{ (grade_cut or grade_node_cut)|string|replace(".",",") }}{% else %} while an average grade could not yet be determined{% endif %}. Within the {{ ranking.student_count }} students of the same semester {{ gender.shehe }} is{% if rankshared_count and rankshared_count>1 %}, together with {{ rankshared_count }} other students,{% elif rankshared_count %}, together with one other student,{% endif %} on rank {{ rank }} within the best {{ percentile }}%.{% if ranking.start_cohort_count %}
At the beginning of their studies in the first semester the cohort started with {{ ranking.start_cohort_count }} students.{% endif %}

maintext.title: Maintext
examples:
Garching, %DATUM_HEUTE%

Betreff: Ihr Studienfortschritt im {{ program.degree_program_name }}

 

%SEHRGEEHRT% %VORNAME% %NAMENSZUSATZ%%FAMILIENNAME%,

die vielfltigen Anforderungen eines Studiums zu erfllen, fllt nicht immer leicht. Die TUM mchte Sie daher hiermit frhzeitig auf offensichtliche Schwierigkeiten in Ihrem Studium aufmerksam machen. Wir empfehlen Ihnen dringend, ber die Ursachen Ihres nicht im Plan liegenden Studienfortschritts nachzudenken und die Studienfachberatung oder andere Anlaufstellen aufzusuchen.

Wir mchten Sie bei der Umsetzung Ihrer eigenen Ziele bestmglich untersttzen. Dazu bentigen wir Ihre Mitwirkung, Ihr Interesse am Studienfach und auch Ihren Willen, die erforderliche Zeit und das unverzichtbare Engagement fr Ihr Studium aufzubringen.

Damit Sie unsere Erwartung an Ihre Mitwirkung einordnen knnen, mchten wir Sie darauf hinweisen, dass wir in der Auslegung unserer Module im Mittel von 30 Stunden Arbeit je Credit ausgehen, was bei 30 Credits pro Semester einer Belastung von 1800 Stunden im Jahr entspricht. Werden Prfungen verzgert, der Studienablauf signifikant verndert oder wird die Arbeit vor allem in die Prfungsvorbereitung geschoben, so steigt der erforderliche Aufwand fr Sie noch einmal zustzlich an. Um das Studium sptestens zum sechsten Fachsemester - also erfolgreich innerhalb der Studienfortschrittskontrolle - abzuschlieen, mssen im Mittel mindestens 20 Credits pro Semester erworben werden.

In Ihrem Fall haben wir festgestellt, dass Sie sich aktuell im {{ fachsemester }}. Fachsemester befinden{% if frv %}, wobei eine gewhrte Fristverlngerung von {% if frv==1 %}einem Semester{% else %}{{ frv }} Semestern{% endif %} bercksichtigt wird,{% endif %} aber bisher lediglich {{ credits }} CP erworben haben.{% if credits and special_warning_credits %} Darunter {{ special_warning_credits }} Credits in physikalischen Spezialfchern.{% endif %}

Was bedeutet das fr die kommenden Semester?

Durch noch nicht bestandene oder aufgeschobene Prfungen kann fr Sie in den nchsten Semestern eine sehr hohe Prfungsbelastung entstehen. Konkret ist fr Ihren Studienerfolg erforderlich: {% for semester in program.progresschecks %}{% if semester.fachsemester>=fachsemester_effective %}nach dem {{ semester.fachsemester + (frv or 0) }}. Fachsemester mindestens {% if semester.credits %}{{ semester.credits }} Credits{% endif %}{% if semester.special_check %}{% if semester.credits %}, davon{% endif %} {{ semester.special_check }}{% endif %}{% if not loop.last %}, {% endif %}{% endif %}{% endfor %}. Wenn diese Grenzen nicht erreicht werden, greift die Studienfortschrittskontrolle mit einem Ausschluss aus dem Studium.

Nehmen Sie daher, soweit noch nicht geschehen, bitte kurzfristig Kontakt mit einer Vertrauensperson Ihrer Wahl oder mit einem der folgenden Ansprechpartner auf:

- Dr. Martin Sa (Sprechstunde i.d.R. Mittwoch und Donnerstag vormittag) oder das Team der Studienberatung in Physik (https://academics.nat.tum.de/beratung#c4487)

- Dr. Katja Block (Sprechstunde Montag 9:30-11:30 und Mittowch 13:30-15:30) als Ansprechpartnerin fr das Studium in besonderen Lebenslagen

- Allgemeine Studienberatung; Untersttzung bei Neuorientierung oder alternativen Studienmglichkeiten sowie Lern- und Prfungscoaching (https://www.tum.de/studium/hilfe-und-beratung)

- Studierendenwerk (https://www.studierendenwerk-muenchen-oberbayern.de/beratungsnetzwerk/): Anlaufstelle fr soziale und wirtschaftliche Fragen wie z.B. Studienfinanzierung, psychologische Beratung etc.

Kommen Sie auf uns zu wir sind fr Sie da.

Ich wnsche Ihnen viel Erfolg in den kommenden Semestern.

Garching, %DATUM_HEUTE%

Subject: Your academic progress in the {{ program.degree_program_name }}

 

Dear %VORNAME% %NAMENSZUSATZ%%FAMILIENNAME%,

keeping apace with the demands of full-time study is not always easy. When difficulties do arise, however, it is best to address them as quickly as possible. We are writing today in an effort to call your attention early to your apparent difficulties in meeting your academic progress targets. We strongly recommend that you consider the factors leading to these difficulties and seek out academic counseling.

Our goal is to support you as good as possible in meeting your own goals. In order to do so, we require your participation, your interest in your field of study and your willingness to devote the necessary time and level of commitment to your degree program.

To help you better understand our expectations, we would like to explain that the design of our degree program modules is based on an average of 30 hours of work per credit, which, at 30 credits per semester, corresponds to a workload of 1800 hours per academic year. If examinations are postponed, if the progression of studies significantly shifts from the planned curriculum, or if the completion of course requirements is pushed into periods of time intended for exam preparation, the effort necessary for you to master the workload increases exponentially. In order to complete the study program within six semesters - and hence within the targets specified by the academic progress check - a student needs to earn on average 20 credits per semester.

In your case, we have found that you have earned only {{ credits }} CP{% if credits and special_warning_credits is not none %} including {{ special_warning_credits }} CP in Physics special courses{% endif %} by your {{ fachsemester }}. semester{% if frv %}, where an extension of {% if frv==1 %}one semester{% else %}{{ frv }} semesters{% endif %} is accounted for{% endif %}.

So what does this mean for the coming semesters?

Examinations that have not yet been passed or have been postponed can place a very high examination load on you in the coming semesters. In concrete terms, to successfully complete your studies, you need to have earned {% for semester in program.progresschecks %}{% if semester.fachsemester>=fachsemester_effective %}after {{ semester.fachsemester + (frv or 0) }}. semester at least{% if semester.credits %} {{ semester.credits }} CP{% endif %}{% if semester.special_check_en %}{% if semester.credits %} and therein{% endif %} {{ semester.special_check_en }}{% endif %}{% if not loop.last %}, {% endif %}{% endif %}{% endfor %}. If these minimums are not achieved, the academic progress check takes effect to expel you from the program.

We, thus, again encourage you to contact the trusted person of your choice or someone at one of the following services as soon as possible:

- Dr. Martin Sa (consultation hour regularly Wednesday and Thursday morning) or the team of study organisation and counceling in Physics (https://academics.nat.tum.de/en/counseling#c4487)

- Dr. Katja Block (consultation hour Monday 9:30-11:30 and Wednesday 13:30-15:30) as contact person for studying with special needs

- Student Advising; support with new academic orientation or alternative options for study, as well as learning and examination coaching (https://www.tum.de/en/studies/support-and-advice)

- Student Union (https://www.studierendenwerk-muenchen-oberbayern.de/en/advisory-network): contact point for social and financial issues, such as paying for your studies, psychological counseling, etc.

Come and talk to us we are here to help.

Wishing you all the best in the coming semesters.

We are writing today in an effort to call your attention early to your apparent difficulties in meeting your academic progress targets. We strongly recommend that you consider the factors leading to these difficulties and seek out academic counseling.

Our goal is to support you as good as possible in meeting your own goals. In order to do so, we require your participation, your interest in your field of study and your willingness to devote the necessary time and level of commitment to your degree program.

To help you better understand our expectations, we would like to explain that the design of our degree program modules is based on an average of 30 hours of work per credit, which, at 30 credits per semester, corresponds to a workload of 1800 hours per academic year. If examinations are postponed, if the progression of studies significantly shifts from the planned curriculum, or if the completion of course requirements is pushed into periods of time intended for exam preparation, the effort necessary for you to master the workload increases exponentially. In order to complete the study program within six semesters - and hence within the targets specified by the academic progress check - a student needs to earn on average 20 credits per semester.

In your case, we have found that you have earned only {{ credits }} CP{% if credits and special_warning_credits is not none %} including {{ special_warning_credits }} CP in Physics special courses{% endif %} by your {{ fachsemester }}. semester{% if frv %}, where an extension of {% if frv==1 %}one semester{% else %}{{ frv }} semesters{% endif %} is accounted for{% endif %}.

So what does this mean for the coming semesters?

Examinations that have not yet been passed or have been postponed can place a very high examination load on you in the coming semesters. In concrete terms, to successfully complete your studies, you need to have earned {% for semester in program.progresschecks %}{% if semester.fachsemester>=fachsemester_effective %}after {{ semester.fachsemester + (frv or 0) }}. semester at least{% if semester.credits %} {{ semester.credits }} CP{% endif %}{% if semester.special_check_en %}{% if semester.credits %} and therein{% endif %} {{ semester.special_check_en }}{% endif %}{% if not loop.last %}, {% endif %}{% endif %}{% endfor %}. If these minimums are not achieved, the academic progress check takes effect to expel you from the program.

We, thus, again encourage you to contact the trusted person of your choice or someone at one of the following services as soon as possible:

- Dr. Martin Sa (consultation hour regularly Wednesday and Thursday morning) or the team of study organisation and counceling in Physics (https://academics.nat.tum.de/en/counseling#c4487)

- Dr. Katja Block (consultation hour Monday 9:30-11:30 and Wednesday 13:30-15:30) as contact person for studying with special needs

- Student Advising; support with new academic orientation or alternative options for study, as well as learning and examination coaching (https://www.tum.de/en/studies/support-and-advice)

- Student Union (https://www.studierendenwerk-muenchen-oberbayern.de/en/advisory-network): contact point for social and financial issues, such as paying for your studies, psychological counseling, etc.

Come and talk to us we are here to help.

Wishing you all the best in the coming semesters.
